truth: -  "The nucleus is the control center of the cell, containing the majority of the cell's genetic material."
fiction: -  "The nucleus is the entertainment center of the cell, containing the majority of the cell's movie collection."

truth: -  "Prokaryotic cells lack a nucleus and other membrane-bound organelles."
fiction: -  "Prokaryotic cells lack a nucleus because they prefer a more minimalist lifestyle."

truth: -  "Eukaryotic cells contain a nucleus and other organelles that are bound by membranes."
fiction: -  "Eukaryotic cells contain a nucleus and other organelles that are bound by magical force fields."

truth: -  "The cell membrane is a biological membrane that separates the interior of all cells from the outside environment."
fiction: -  "The cell membrane is a biological curtain that separates the stage of all cells from the audience."

truth: -  "Ribosomes are the protein factories of the cell, translating RNA into proteins."
fiction: -  "Ribosomes are the fashion factories of the cell, designing the latest trends in cell clothing."

truth: -  "Lysosomes are organelles that contain digestive enzymes to break down waste materials and cellular debris."
fiction: -  "Lysosomes are organelles that contain cleaning supplies to tidy up the cell's living space."

truth: -  "The endoplasmic reticulum is involved in protein and lipid synthesis."
fiction: -  "The endoplasmic reticulum is involved in the synthesis of gourmet meals for the cell."

truth: -  "The Golgi apparatus is responsible for packaging proteins for transport out of the cell."
fiction: -  "The Golgi apparatus is responsible for packaging holiday gifts for other cells."

truth: -  "Chloroplasts are the sites of photosynthesis in plant cells."
fiction: -  "Chloroplasts are the sites of art classes in plant cells."

truth: -  "Cytoskeleton provides the cell with structure and shape."
fiction: -  "Cytoskeleton provides the cell with a trendy wardrobe and fashion advice."

truth: -  "Centrioles help with cell division in animal cells."
fiction: -  "Centrioles help with party planning in animal cells."

truth: -  "The cell wall provides an extra layer of protection to plant cells."
fiction: -  "The cell wall provides an extra layer of wallpaper to plant cells for interior decoration."

truth: -  "Vacuoles store water, nutrients, and waste products in cells."
fiction: -  "Vacuoles store books, games, and snacks for cells' leisure time."

truth: -  "Mitosis is the process by which a eukaryotic cell separates the chromosomes in its cell nucleus into two identical sets."
fiction: -  "Mitosis is the process by which a eukaryotic cell separates the books in its library into two identical sets."

truth: -  "Meiosis is a type of cell division that results in four daughter cells each with half the number of chromosomes of the parent cell."
fiction: -  "Meiosis is a type of cell division that results in four daughter cells each with half the number of video games of the parent cell."

truth: -  "Cytokinesis is the physical process of cell division, which divides the cytoplasm of a parental cell into two daughter cells."
fiction: -  "Cytokinesis is the physical process of cell division, which divides the cookie dough of a parental cell into two daughter cookies."

truth: -  "Cellular respiration is the set of metabolic reactions and processes that take place in the cells of organisms to convert biochemical energy from nutrients into adenosine triphosphate (ATP)."
fiction: -  "Cellular respiration is the set of culinary reactions and processes that take place in the cells of organisms to convert ingredients into delicious meals."

truth: -  "Apoptosis is the process of programmed cell death."
fiction: -  "Apoptosis is the process of programmed cell retirement, complete with a farewell party."

truth: -  "Endocytosis is a cellular process in which substances are brought into the cell."
fiction: -  "Endocytosis is a cellular process in which mail packages are brought into the cell."

truth: -  "Exocytosis is the process by which a cell transports secretory products through the cytoplasm to the plasma membrane."
fiction: -  "Exocytosis is the process by which a cell transports its luggage through the cytoplasm to the airport."
